name: Usage
comment: Maintains the usage event details that were rated by the rater. This includes both pre paid and post paid usage data. For example, if a user makes a call of 10 min, the rater decides the amount that needs to be charged for the call.
vf short description: Maintains the usage event details that were rated by the rater. This includes both pre paid and post paid usage data. For example, if a user makes a call of 10 min, the rater decides the amount that needs to be charged for the call.

fields.name: EventId
fields.comment: Indicates a unique identifier of the event in the source system. APE1_RATED_EVENT.EVENT_ID

fields.name: EventStartDate
fields.comment: Indicates the start date and time of the CDR. Trunc(APE1_RATED_EVENT.START_TIME)

fields.name: EventStartTime
fields.comment: Specifies the event start date and time, which is used by the rater for qualification and rating of the event. The start time is usually the same as the network start time, but this can change during error management. APE1_RATED_EVENT.START_TIME

fields.name: CallEndDatetime
fields.comment: Specifies the end date and time of the usage CDR event. APE1_RATED_EVENT.START_TIME + APE1_RATED_EVENT.Lx_DURATION//Please validate during implementation

fields.name: HourCode
fields.comment: Code that represents the hour in a day. Valued values are, 0 to 23. EXTRACT (HH24 FROM APE1_RATED_EVENT.START_TIME)

fields.name: CallingNumber
fields.comment: Indicates the calling number. It stores the A-number for outgoing Events and B-Number for incoming Events. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_CALLING_NUMBER

fields.name: CalledNumber
fields.comment: Indicates the called number. It stores the A-number for incoming Events and B-Number for outgoing Events. APE1_RATED_EVENT.l3_called_number

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SubscriberSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SubscriberMainOfferSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SubscriberSalesChannelSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BillingArrangementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ServiceProviderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: NotChargedServiceProviderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: OriginatingCountrySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: TerminatingCountrySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SpecialNumberSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: EventDirectionInd
fields.comment: Specifies the call direction.Values are:- I=Incoming- O=Outgoing- C=Incoming, Outgoing and Call Forward APE1_RATED_EVENT.l3_call_direction

fields.name: OnNetFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the CDR is On-Net or Off-Net. This indicator is used to verify that the calling and called numbers belong to the same operator. Based on APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_ONNET_OFFNET_IND//Usually it is the column specified but please check during cutomization.

fields.name: CurrencySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CellSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CitySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CustomerMvnoFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the customer belongs to MVNO.Values are:- 1 - Customer belongs to MVNO.- 0 - Customer does not belong to MVNO. Lookup in Customer for Customer MVNO Flag based on APE1_RATED_EVENT.CUSTOMER_ID

fields.name: BillingCycleInstanceSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: EquipmentCatalogSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: Imei
fields.comment: Indicates the IMEI code of the handset used during an Event. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_IMEI

fields.name: Imsi
fields.comment: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI). It is a unique number associated with all mobile handset users, and stored in the SIM card. IMSI is usually 15 digits. The first three digits indicate the mobile country code, and the following two or three digits indicate the mobile network code. The remaining digits uniquely identify a subscriber within that network.The IMSI is used in any mobile network that interconnects with other networks, in particular CDMA, EVDO, and GSM networks. This number is provisioned in the phone directly or in the R-UIM card, which is a CDMA analog equivalent to a GSM SIM card. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_IMSI

fields.name: TacNumber
fields.comment: Indicates the first eight-digits of the 15-digit IMEI code used to uniquely identify wireless devices. The Type Allocation Code identifies a particular model of a wireless telephone and uses it on a GSM, UMTS, or IMEI-supporting wireless network. //Customized: Extract the TAC code - SUBSTRING(1, 8, APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_IMSI)

fields.name: RerateTypeFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the event can be rerated. CASE WHEN APE1_RATED_EVENT.RERATE_TYPE = Y THEN 1 ELSE 0END

fields.name: ReratedFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the event can be rerated. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_RERATE_IND //To be validated during customization.

fields.name: RatedAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the amount before any discounting process for this specific transaction. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Amount

fields.name: ChargeAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the amount after discount process for this specific transaction. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Charge Amount

fields.name: DiscountAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the discount amount for a transaction, which is the difference between the charged amount and the rated amount, excluding VAT. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Discount Amount

fields.name: RatedNetAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the amount before any discounting process for this specific transaction, excluding VAT. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Net Amount

fields.name: DiscountNetAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the discount amount for a transaction, which is the difference between the charged amount and the rated amount, excluding VAT. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Discount Net Amount

fields.name: ChargeNetAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the amount after discount process for this specific transaction, excluding VAT. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Charge Net Amount

fields.name: ActualDuration
fields.comment: Specifies the actual event duration in seconds. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Duration

fields.name: Duration
fields.comment: Length of a usage transaction, which is the elapsed time between start timestamp and end timestamp, but rounded up to nearest charging interval. The intervals may vary between countries, price plans, traffic groups, and so on. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Rounded Duration

fields.name: BillableDuration
fields.comment: Indicates the net duration of the call after any discount. In relation to the rate, excluding any type of free minutes. For example, if the Duration is 90, Charged Duration (after rounding) is 120, and you have 60 second for free, then the Billable Duration is 60 seconds. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Billed Duration

fields.name: UpstreamDataVolume
fields.comment: Indicates the upstream data volume for the event in KB. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Upstream Volume

fields.name: DownstreamDataVolume
fields.comment: Specifies the downstream data volume in Kilobyte, for the event. APE1_RATED_EVENT.N_12  / APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Downstream Volume //To be validated during customization

fields.name: TotalDataVolume
fields.comment: Indicates the Total Data Volume for an event. This includes the upstream and downstream volume. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.lx_Volume

fields.name: NetworkSourceId
fields.comment: Indicates the identifier of the network source. APE1_RATED_EVENT.SOURCE_ID

fields.name: ServiceFilter
fields.comment: Attribute that is used by the rater to direct the event to the appropriate service, for example, voice, sms and data. APE1_RATED_EVENT.Lx_Service_filter

fields.name: RoamingFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the usage event is a roaming event. APE1_RATED_EVENT.C1_6 //To be validated during customization

fields.name: BillingOfferSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AccessPointName
fields.comment: Access Point Name used by the mobile device to establish a data connection with the carrier. APE1_RATED_EVENT.C128_2 //Validate during customization

fields.name: AccessPointGroupCode
fields.comment: Indicates the group name assigned to the Access Point by the carrier. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_APN_GROUP

fields.name: FinancialAccountSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ActualDataVolume
fields.comment: Indicates the amount of data volume used during the event. //Customized mapping: usually from APE1_RATED_EVENT.l3_Volume

fields.name: AllowanceTraversal
fields.comment: Indicates the allowance traversal field. It defines for an event, the allowances from which offers are used, if the call moves from one plan to another during its duration.Format : #Offer id#item id#initial quota#Remaining quota#Used Quota|  If multiple offers are applicable, then they are separated by  a pipe symbol (|). APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_ALLOWANCE_TRAVERSAL //Check during cutomization.

fields.name: BillingCycleSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BillableUnit
fields.comment: Number of billable units. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_ROUNDED_UNIT - APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_FREE_UNIT

fields.name: CallForwardFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the call has been forwarded to a new destination. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_CALL_FORWARD_IND

fields.name: CallSubTypeCode
fields.comment: Defines the event sub type. Along with call type, the event sub type is used to identify the detailed service types. For example, local voice, international sms, and so on. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_CALL_SUB_TYPE//Usually it is the column specified. Check during cutomization.

fields.name: CallTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CalledZone
fields.comment: Indicates the zone to which a call was made. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_CALLED_ZONE//Usually it is the column specified but please check during customization.

fields.name: CallingZone
fields.comment: Indicates the zone from which a call was made. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_CALLING_ZONE //Check during cutomization.

fields.name: ChargeCodeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FreeAllowanceAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the charge amount, including the free allowance granted to the customer on that event. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_CHG_AMT_INC_FREE_ALLOW

fields.name: UnitOfMeasureInd
fields.comment: Indicates the unit of measurement of the usage event.Values are:S - SecondsO - occurrenceK - KBG-GbytesM-Minutes APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_UOM

fields.name: ChargingTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the charging type that is applicable on the call.Values are:PT u00E2u20ACu201C Private tier (tier of a single subscriber )ST u00E2u20ACu201C Shared tierSA u00E2u20ACu201C Shared allowanceBO u00E2u20ACu201C  Both shared allowance and shared tierNA - Normal Rating APE1_RATED_EVENT.C2_5 //Please validate during implementation

fields.name: TaxCodeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExchangeCode
fields.comment: Specifies the exchange code for the GPRS events. For example, 2G, 3G, and 4G. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_EXCHANGE_CODE//Usually it is the column specified but please check during cutomization.

fields.name: FreeOccurrence
fields.comment: Indicates the free data in minutes or seconds, or number of SMS or MMS, which are not chargeable to the customer. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_FREE_OCCURRENCE

fields.name: InterfaceTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the interface type that is used for the call.For example, VOICE, DATA, MMS and SMS. APE1_RATED_EVENT.l9_interface_name//Usually it is the column specified but please check during cutomization.

fields.name: LocationAreaCode
fields.comment: Area Code of the location from where the call has been made. APE1_RATED_EVENT.C16_1 //To be validated during customization

fields.name: MonetaryTraversal
fields.comment: Indicates a field similar to allowance traversal with a difference that the measure involved is money. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L9_MONETARY_TRAVERSAL//Usually it is the column specified but please check during cutomization.

fields.name: NetworkStartTime
fields.comment: Indicates the original start date or time of the event. APE1_RATED_EVENT.NETWORK_START_TIME

fields.name: PayChannelSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PaymentCategorySK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: RoundedUnit
fields.comment: Defines the rounded unit as per the rounding factor defined for the offer. Unit can be seconds, occurrences or volume. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_ROUNDED_UNIT

fields.name: ServiceTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PeriodInd
fields.comment: Indicates whether the call duration period was peak or off peak. APE1_RATED_EVENT.L3_STARTING_PERIOD

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which the record was created in the source system. APE1_RATED_EVENT.SYS_CREATION_DATE

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system APE1_RATED_EVENT.SYS_UPDATE_DATE

fields.name: EventTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AssignedBillingOfferSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: OfferBundleFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether the offer is a bundled product offer, hence if event was rated out of the bundleValues are:- 1 - Bundled offer- 0 - Not a bundled offer Product Catalog.Offer Bundle Flaglookup Product Catalog on Product Catalog Key = Usage.Assigned Billing Offer Key

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
